Interface_name: TCP Server - side based on node.js net
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a TCP server in Node.js that serves Flash cross-domain policy files to clients, handling connections, errors, and policy file generation dynamically.

Class Description: The Server class implements a TCP server that listens for Flash policy file requests and responds with an appropriate cross-domain policy XML. It handles server lifecycle events, client connections, and dynamic policy configuration.

Attributes:
- origins: [Array] - List of allowed domains and ports in "domain:port" format
- port: [Number] - TCP port to listen on (default: 843)
- log: [Function] - Logging function (default: console.log)
- socket: [net.Server] - The TCP server instance
- server: [Object] - Optional fallback HTTP server
- buffer: [Buffer] - Compiled policy file in binary format

Methods:
- constructor(options, origins) -> [Server] - Initializes the server with configuration options and allowed origins
- listen(port, server, cb) -> [Server] - Starts listening on specified port, with optional fallback server and callback
- responder(socket) -> [void] - Responds to client connections with policy file
- compile() -> [Server] - Generates the policy file XML and converts it to buffer
- add() -> [Server] - Adds one or more allowed origins to the policy
- remove(origin) -> [Server] - Removes a specific origin from the policy
- close() -> [Server] - Closes the server and cleans up resources
